paper_metadata.title: Genotype–phenotype correlation and course of transthyretin familial amyloid polyneuropathies in France
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual patient details.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with severe disease progression.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is the most studied variant in TTR-related amyloidosis.
key_quotes: French Ile107Val, Ser77Tyr, and LateVal30Met FAP showed more rapid and severe disease progression.

functional_data.summary: The Ser77Tyr mutation is associated with severe disease progression.

variants.segregation_data: The Ser77Tyr mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The Ser77Tyr mutation is less common than Val30Met but still significant.
key_quotes: French Ile107Val, Ser77Tyr, and LateVal30Met FAP showed more rapid and severe disease progression.

functional_data.summary: The Ile107Val mutation is associated with severe disease progression.

variants.segregation_data: The Ile107Val mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The Ile107Val mutation is associated with the most debilitating and severe FAP.
key_quotes: Ile107Val and LateMet30 mutations are associated with the most debilitating and severe FAP ever described.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants were extracted with associated clinical and penetrance data.
